thread.title: High school football roundup: St. Francis has finishing kick
thread.title_full: High school football roundup: St. Francis has finishing kick - Sports - The Buffalo News

author: buffalonews
title: High school football roundup: St. Francis has finishing kick
text:
The score provided a valuable clue as to how the game between St. Francis and St. Mary’s of Lancaster in the Msgr. Martin Association went on Saturday afternoon: St. Francis 42, St. Mary’s 41.
It was one of those contests that seemed like the team with the ball last would win.
“That’s exactly what I was thinking,” a somewhat hoarse St. Francis coach Jerry Smith said afterwards. “It was exciting for the fans. We can’t stop anybody but we can score.”
The Red Raiders erased a 35-21 second-half deficit. A key play came in the fourth quarter, when Sean Campbell blocked an extra point after the Lancers had taken the lead. Then St. Francis scored the game-tying touchdown on a 21-yard pass from Jerry Hickson to Jacob Tasker. Robert Barbieri kicked the extra point that made the difference in the game.
“St. Mary’s had the ball with just under four minutes left, but turned the ball over on downs at our 25,” Smith said. “Tom Acurri had a big sack. He broke through and got the quarterback when it looked like one of their guys was wide open.”
Hickson threw for three touchdowns and ran for two others as his team improved to 3-3 overall.
For St. Mary’s (2-4), Takal Molson threw four touchdown passes and ran for a pair of scores.
“He’s one of the best athletes I’ve seen,” Smith said about the Lancers’ standout.
“We’ve got to tackle better. We’ve got Cathedral Prep coming up next week.”
Class A North
Williamsville South 35, Kenmore East 12: The Billies scored the first 28 points of the game, all in the first half, and went on to the victory. Quarterback Jack Holyoke had an efficient afternoon, going 10 for 14 for 110 yards and four touchdowns. Matt Foster caught two of those touchdown passes. Justin Moon blocked a punt and recovered a loose ball for a Williamsville South touchdown. Luke Corona supplied eight tackles and Travis Porterfield had a sack.
Williamsville North 33, Williamsville East 9: Jason Hwang ran for 127 yards on 12 carries with two touchdowns, and threw for another score for the Spartans. Andrew Hwang added 81 yards and a score on the ground. Meanwhile, Connor Kelly made 12 tackles and a sack.
Sweet Home 23, Grand Island 13: The Panthers’ 23 straight points were sandwiched around two Vikings scores. Dylan McDuffie carried the ball 18 times for 83 yards for Sweet Home, which had a strong defensive game as well. The Panthers forced three turnovers, including two fumble recoveries, as they moved to 2-4 on the season.
Class A South
McKinley 20, Hamburg 13: Keyon Johnson of the Macks finally put away the Bulldogs with a 60-yard touchdown run in the fourth quarter. Johnson ran for 160 yards, and added 49 receiving yards and 35 passing yards. He also scored another touchdown. Jeremiah Moore ran for two touchdowns for McKinley.
Class B West
Burgard 52, Newfane 7: The Bulldogs piled up 380 yards rushing, with eight different players getting a chance to run the ball. Dominic Prince set the tone with a 62-yard run to open the scoring. He went on to total 152 yards and four touchdowns on four carries. Andrew Gamblin had 100 yards in five carries and a score. Dejean McCullough made two interceptions for the Bulldogs.
Class B East
Albion 30, Barker/Roy-Hart 13: The Purple Eagles came on with a rush to win. Albion and Barker/R-H both scored first quarter touchdowns, but the Purple Eagles had a 24-6 edge the rest of the way to earn their second victory. The win came even though Albion had twice as many penalties and lost the time of possession battle, 28:46 to 19:14. Barker/R-H fell to 1-5 overall.
Nonleague
Lockport 32, Frontier 3: Khalil James ran for 101 yards and caught a touchdown pass in the Lions’ win. Javon Ford added two touchdown passes and ran for another score, while Angelo Nunnari returned an interception 35 yards for a touchdown.
Niagara-Wheatfield 40, Lewiston-Porter 12: Running back Ko’Daryll Welch had a nice day for the Falcons. He scored two touchdowns, one on the ground and one in the air, and picked up 93 yards rushing. Quarterback Matt Mixon threw two touchdown passes, including an 80-yard bomb to Tom Watroba that opened the scoring. Niagara-Wheatfield had a 27-6 lead at halftime.
Villanova College (Ont.) 21, Nichols 6: The Vikings only could score on a 2-yard fumble return by Paul Brinson in a loss to a team from north of Toronto. Manny Williams ran for 153 yards, while Brandon Rivers added 11 tackles.
